de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.itemstate

Class AbstractItemStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType extends AbstractListDecorator<DataType>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ViewHolder>
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
          • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.itemstate.AbstractItemStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter<AbsListView>, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, SortableListAdapter<DataType>, ListAdapter<DataType>, Loggable, RecyclerViewAdapter, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSortableListAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractItemStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType extends AbstractListDecorator<DataType>>
extends AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
implements ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may have multiple states. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      protected static java.lang.String NUMBER_OF_ITEM_STATES_BUNDLE_KEY

      The key, which is used to store, whether the state of an item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, or not, within a bundle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractItemStateListAdapter

        protected AbstractItemStateListAdapter(Context context,
                                       DecoratorType decorator,
                                       LogLevel logLevel,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Item<DataType>> items,
                                       boolean allowDuplicates,
                                       boolean notifyOnChange,
                                       java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemClickListener<DataType>> itemClickListeners,
                                       java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemLongClickListener<DataType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                       java.util.Set<ListAdapterListener<DataType>> adapterListeners,
                                       java.util.Set<ListEnableStateListener<DataType>> enableStateListeners,
                                       int numberOfItemStates,
                                       boolean triggerItemStateOnClick,
                                       java.util.Set<ListItemStateListener<DataType>> itemStateListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may have multiple states.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        items - A list, which contains the adapter's items, or an empty list, if the adapter should not contain any items
        allowDuplicates - True, if duplicate items should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        enableStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        numberOfItemStates - The number of states, the adapter's items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        triggerItemStateOnClick - True, if the state of an item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        itemStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

      • setNumberOfItemStates

        public final void setNumberOfItemStates(int numberOfItemStates)
        Description copied from interface: ItemStateListAdapter
        Sets the number of states, the adapter's items may have. If the number of states is set to a value, less than the previous value, the states of the items, which became obsolete, will be set to the maximum state.
        Specified by:
        setNumberOfItemStates in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        numberOfItemStates - The number of states, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown

        Specified by:
        getItemState in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the given item as an Integer value

      • setItemState

        public final int setItemState(int index,
                              int state)
        Description copied from interface: ItemStateListAdapter
        Sets the state of the item, which belongs to a specific index, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Specified by:
        setItemState in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setItemState

                              int state)

        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown

        Specified by:

      • triggerItemState

        public final int triggerItemState(int index)
        Description copied from interface: ItemStateListAdapter
        Triggers the state of the item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Specified by:
        triggerItemState in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerItemState

        public final int triggerItemState(DataType item)
        Description copied from interface: ItemStateListAdapter
        Triggers the state of a specific item, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Specified by:
        triggerItemState in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given item, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

        Description copied from interface: ItemStateListAdapter

        Specified by:
        triggerAllItemStates in interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Returns:
